biography: We, Dockem, are a small company founded by 2 brothers, Chris and Colby Moyer. We launched our first product (a smartphone wall mount) here on Kickstarter in 2011 when it was still in relative infancy. At that point, working fully for ourselves was still a dream. Since that first product launch, however, we've both managed to shift over to working on our entrepreneurial dream full time for the past 8 years and have even brought in new team members to support us as we grow.With happy customers all over the globe, we're still working together day in and day out designing, sourcing, shipping, and promoting our unique line of products. We've launched 2 more mounts here on Kickstarter (which are still some of our best sellers today) while adding other unique items along the way. Not only do we take great pride in the unique features and affordability of our products, but we also take great pride in our reputation and the customer support that we provide. We deliver on our promises and make it our goal to go above and beyond (check out our Amazon reviews and feedback!).We've been perfecting and relentlessly testing our wallet for over a year now, so we are looking forward to finally getting it into your hands. We hope you'll join us for the Rȳd!
name: Chris & Colby Moyer

biography: I'm into stories: epic sagas, little tales, cute vignettes, nasty fables, clever lies, and epic mythologies.I'm a writer, editor, and game designer. I lead the team at Games Omniverse, where we're building games and stories set in the Dire Multiverse.I've written for games such as CONTROL, Guild Wars 2, Forgotten Realms, and the World of Darkness series.I co-edited the DEEP CUTS: MAYHEM, MENACE, AND MISERY anthology which honored women horror writers and was a Kickstarter success!I'm one of the founders of The Wyrdwood Project and am writing a novel series set in magickal, mystical Wyrdwood. I've been writing horror stories since I was a kid, and I can't seem to break this morbid fascination I have with all things spooky occulty.If you're in either the SFWA or HWA, me too!

biography: Ned Courtright, AKA Stephen Hines, was spawned, and currently lives, in Ohio. When he’s not infiltrating the system by teaching high school English, he’s holed up in his home writing. To date, he’s published one graphic novel (Valedictorian USA: Vol. 1), a young adult novel (Hocus Focus), a one-shot surrealist horror comic (Icon-O-Plastic), and two complete comic book trilogies:  Zombie Fabulous and The Soccer Mom Killer. His prose memoir, Rebirth Defect: My Journey From Catholic Altar Boy to Teen Atheist to Adult Christian Metal Evangelist and Back to Atheism, was released in 2016. He also released a mini-album of original music called The Punk-Metal E.P.So far he's completed six successful Kickstarter campaigns.
name: Ned Courtright

biography: I have been an artist since in the womb!  Props to my mom!  She helped me to grow my imagination.  My parents have always supported my creativeness, often getting many laughs from my weird sense of humor and ideas! Growing up I was very geeky (when geek wasn't sheek) lolI really love the differences in people.  Average is so boring!I am also a mom. When my little girl was younger she started going to these conventions.  Conventions what's that?  So I saw her making clothes and outfits out of curtains, scraps and old clothes.  She is so good at sewing something out of nothing.  I started looking into them, that's when I fell in love with Steampunk!  Oh yeah Steampunk is so interesting.  It was kinda around when I was growing up, but it never really had a name to it.  So flash forward and sniff, sniff my girl is off to college.  So I have a lot of time on my hands and started learning more about spray paint art, up-cycling and anything new in the art field.  I am a professional graphic artist and most is digital work nowadays, but I really enjoy when you can hold art in your hands or on the wall.
name: Paula

biography: Scott Lininger is a writer and illustrator in Colorado. His fiction has appeared in the likes of Roar and Thunder, The Battered Suitcase, Flash Fiction Online, Everyday Weirdness, Powderburn, Resident Aliens, Day Terrors Anthology, Wretched Moments Anthology, Mystericale, Daily Science Fiction, the Flash Fiction Offensive, and Short Story Me, as well as the So Long and Thanks for All the Brains Anthology. Scott is an Associate Member of the SFWA and SCBWI. He's co-founder of BlindLuck Game Studios and author of the Window RPG. For his day job he's the founder of Bitsbox, an edtech startup that teaches kids to code.

biography:
Brought up in the UK, taught bridge as a child, but then distracted by study, love, work, hard-times, good-times, emigration (to continental Europe) parenthood... I never took it up again until three years ago. And I fell for the game hook, line and sinker.
BBO: alanrickLived as an adult in Canterbury, Oxford, York, London, Luxemburg, Hamburg, and now Wiesloch near Heidelberg.I started my career as a teacher, left to join a software company, because I  get most thrills from producing something physical or lasting like a publication, a book or software.  Author of the best-selling workflow book, the authors' royalities donated 100% directly to Doctors Without Borders (MSF)Art plays an important role in my life, a peaceful alternative to pressures at work or the rush of adrenalin while playing cards, So a project to create a picture, a unique and appealing picture, with a purpose, is worth striving for.If you want a simple explanation of how this whole thing works please visit http://www.thank-you-partner.com/the-crowdfunding-party/
